content: page 319. 2.8.3 Capacity Backup Upgrade Capacity Backup Upgrade (CBU) delivers temporary backup capacity in addition to the capacity that an installation might have available in numbers of assigned CPs, IFLs, ICFs, and zIIPs. CBU has the following types:  CBU for CP  CBU for IFL  CBU for ICF  CBU for zIIP When CBU for CP is added within the same capacity setting range (indicated by the model capacity identifier) as the currently assigned PUs, the total number of active PUs (the sum of all assigned CPs, IFLs, ICFs, and zIIPs) plus the number of CBUs cannot exceed the total number of PUs that are available in the system.
